tool.name: CopyTraversedSourceFeaturesWithTransit
tool.displayname: Copy Traversed Source Features With Transit

param.name: input_network_analysis_layer
param.dialogReference: The Route, Closest Facility, and Service Area layer for which to save the traversal result with added transit information. If the network analysis layer does not have a valid result, the layer will be solved to produce one. The input network analysis layer must have a time of day set and must use a travel mode whose impedance attribute uses the Public Transit evaluator. Layers using a service URL as their network data source are not supported.

param.name: output_location
param.dialogReference: The workspace where the output table and two feature classes will be saved.

param.name: edge_feature_class_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the feature class that will contain information about the traversed edge source features, including the added public transit information.

param.name: junction_feature_class_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the feature class that will contain information about the traversed junction source features, including system junctions and relevant points from the input network analysis layer.

param.name: turn_table_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the table that will contain information about the traversed global turns and turn features that scale cost for the underlying edges.

idCitation.resTitle: Copy Traversed Source Features With Transit
